channel.title: Java not reconised!
channel.description: when i run the server run,bat or compiler it just comes up saying javac is not reconised as an internal or external command .. how do i fix it...

item.title: Java not reconised!
item.dc:creator: @Eddie12390 Eddie12390
item.description:
@Eddie12390 wrote:

You resent my opinion? It isn’t an opinion. Check the inside of run.bat and runserver.bat

The only time it would be different is if it was a client, where there wouldn’t be a runserver because you aren’t starting up the server from the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Java not reconised!
item.dc:creator: @Doom32dd Doom32dd
item.description:
@Doom32dd wrote:

i resent your opinion… i have seen run (run the server) and runserver (idk what it was but when i edited it it dodnt look like something for a server to run)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 11, 2008, 03:21:50 pm[/size][hr][quote=“sticky wicky, post:1, topic:243034”]run, bat or compiler it just comes up saying “javac is not reconised as an internal or external command” … how do i fix it…[/quote]
well for comiler, download and install JDK 6u10 and use this compiler

XD edit:

@echo off
color 0a
title Team Termination Compiler
“C:/program files/java/jdk1.6.0_10/bin/javac” *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Java not reconised!
item.dc:creator: @Eddie12390 Eddie12390
item.description:
@Eddie12390 wrote:

He doesn’t need a new source. He just doesn’t have his JDK version set correctly in his run and compiler.

Run and runserver are THE SAME EXACT THING! A compiler compiles files, so why would you say you needed a compile and a compiler?

Read full topic

item.title: Java not reconised!
item.dc:creator: @Doom32dd Doom32dd
item.description:
@Doom32dd wrote:

hes having issues with run, runserver, compile, not just compiler, i think you need a new source or something :\

Read full topic

item.title: Java not reconised!
item.dc:creator: @Eddie12390 Eddie12390
item.description:
@Eddie12390 wrote:

Ok, right click on your compiler and hit edit. All compiler’s are different, some say to set your java version and program files, others just have an exact link to the java.

Open My Computer > Local Disk Drive C:\ > Program Files > Java > JDK (version) > bin and copy the location your at from the bar and paste that into your compiler.

If you don’t know how, tell me what version of Java you have and post the code inside your compiler and I’ll edit it for you

Read full topic

item.title: Java not reconised!

item.description:
@sic_pure wrote:

I’m having the same prob but I can’t find where the JDK I downloaded is its not even showing up in search.

Read full topic

item.title: Java not reconised!
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Set your path and variables correctly,
Also if the compiler isn’t using the JDK version you have,
Change it to the correct version.
